description: Dive into "Fukuoka's Coastal Escapes: Beach Bliss Awaits" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Fukuoka's Coastal Escapes: Beach Bliss Awaits

places.generalDescription: Momochi Seaside Park is a popular manmade beach in Fukuoka, Japan, featuring a long stretch of sand perfect for activities like volleyball. The area is home to several famous landmarks such as the Fukuoka Tower and the Fukuoka City Museum. It's conveniently located just 15-20 minutes from downtown via bus or subway, making it an ideal place to take a break or enjoy a relaxing stroll.

sources.snippet: While there are a tonne of great beaches in Fukuoka, Momochi Seaside Park is one of the closest to the city, making it a convenient way to enjoy the great outdoors. In summer, you‚Äôll find the beach filled with people playing volleyball, soccer and rugby or perhaps searching for clams and splashing around in the swimming zone. Facility-wise, the restrooms, showers, shaded pergola and beach tents provide all the comfort you could need‚Äîand more‚Äî on a beach day.
sources.shortName: Fukuoka City Beach Park & Momochi Seaside Park

sources.snippet: Probably the most well-known spot in Fukuoka City limits, this artificial beach is located right next to Fukuoka Tower, Fukuoka Yafuoku!. Dome, and the beautiful Momochihama district, facing out toward Hakata Bay. While not the cleanest beach around, it boasts easy access as well as the convenience of numerous nearby restaurants, surf shops, convenience stores and more.
sources.shortName: Fukuoka Beach Guide

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a beach day in Fukuoka, Momochi Seaside Park offers everything you need!. Located in the heart of the city ‚Äì next to the Fukuoka tower ‚Äì Momochi Seaside Park comprises three main beaches:. Each beach is man-made and protected by breakwaters, ensuring the sand remains golden and free of overly-intrusive waves.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Things to Do in Fukuoka for Foreigners

sources.snippet: Not many cities are blessed with a beach on their doorstep, but Fukuoka is one of the lucky few. It‚Äôs a stone‚Äôs throw away from sights like Fukuoka Tower and Fukuoka City Museum. There‚Äôs a shopping complex nearby and a whole slew of restaurants that draw locals at all hours of the day, all year round.
sources.siteName: VISIT FUKUOKA -Fukuoka Prefecture Official Travel Guide
sources.shortName: Local Life in Fukuoka City: Art, Beaches and Coffee | Highlights

sources.snippet: The primary waterfront in Fukuoka is none other than Seaside Momochi. Also known as Shisaido Momochi in Japanese, Seaside Momochi is situated on reclaimed land that was made along Hakata Bay. Initially, the area was developed to serve as the site of the Asia Pacific Expo in the year 1989.
sources.shortName: Take Your Pick At the Many Beaches of Fukuoka

sources.snippet: Highlights: Modern beach, Marizon building and wharf, beautiful promenade, restaurants, and cafes. Nearby attractions: Fukuoka Tower, PayPay Dome, teamLab Forest Fukuoka. Events to look out for: Beach festivals, fireworks displays.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Fukuoka to Visit (+ Tips for Visiting)
Things to see, things to eat, what to buy, things to do, and things to know

places.name: Momochi Seaside Park

reviews.text:
A place to enjoy an ice cream from one of the few stalls.

The beach is just at the back of the tower.

Grainy, yellowish sand. I think it's not ideal for swimming; it's just a place to stroll around.

Very, very nice park and beach. Dunno what it's like when it's open for swimming, but otherwise it's a perfect place to take a stroll, relax or play on the sand, or just take in the scenery.
There are also a few food stalls/restaurants close to that wedding mansion, so you won't starve for refreshments there

A good choice for leisure in Fukuoka Hakata area. The beach is okay, sand is good. But when we went, there was a foul smell in the sea breeze similar to a rotting crab (probably an isolated case). Locals are freely swimming in the area, and some groups bring their own food to celebrate. There is no entrance fee. There are lots of restrooms, and restaurants are in an area accessible by the beach. It's just a few-minute walk from bus stations, and nearby the Fukuoka Tower. Best place to watch sunset as it is located in the western part of Kyushu island.

places.address: 2 Chome-902-1 Momochihama, Sawara Ward, Fukuoka, 814-0001, Japan

places.generalDescription: Sakurai Futamigaura's Couple Stones, also known as 'couple rocks,' are a scenic spot featuring two large rocks connected by a Shinto rope. Located about 150m offshore from the Sakurai Shrine in Fukuoka Prefecture, these rocks are enshrined as a sacred place and represent the god of marriage. The male rock stands at 11.8 meters while the female rock is 11.

sources.snippet: On the west side, Futamigaura and Imazu are excellent locales for glamping, fishing, or seaside dining, and can be reached by bus, car, or bicycle. West Coast Liner buses go direct from Tenjin and Hakata, and local buses depart from Imajuku Station or Kyudai-gakkentoshi Station in Fukuoka‚Äôs Nishi Ward. Shops around these stations and along the west coast also offer bicycle rentals.
sources.shortName: Coastal Escapes | Search

sources.snippet: Futamigaura has an array of facilities, including beach huts and restaurants, so all you need is a towel and a swimsuit. Its views of the sunset over the Genkai Sea are considered to be some of the best around, and Sakurai Shrine‚Äôs meoto-iwa (husband and wife rocks) are a well-known sight. Futamigaura is ranked as one of the 100 best beaches in Japan.
sources.shortName: Fukuoka Beach Guide

sources.snippet: The best time to visit the area is during sunset wherein visitors can watch the sun goes down over the Genkai Sea. It is also popular for Sakurai Shrine‚Äôs meoto-iwa, which are the ‚Äúhusband and wife rocks.‚Äù This beach is also classified as one of the 100 best beaches in the country.
sources.shortName: Take Your Pick At the Many Beaches of Fukuoka

sources.snippet: This beach offers excellent waves and the most diverse selection of cafes in Itoshima, including the iconic Sunset Cafe. There are now too many cafes to mention. The area has seen explosive growth in recent years.
sources.shortName: Fukuoka Beach Guide 2024

places.name: Sakurai Futamigaura's Couple Stones

reviews.text:
Lots of tourists and cafes around. You may find restaurants that are equally nice than the popular seafood restaurant.

Overall it's a very nice and chill beach which resembles Hawaii/ Australia üòä

Do note that everywhere requires parking fee.

a good place to visit if you rent a hotel or resort near here. not highly recommended for those who stay in fukuoka center then making a trip here cause it quiet an effort to do so. check the weather on your phone with Itoshima location before you go to make sure you are on the sunset time. mine were 19:31 so i missed it

Sakurai Shrine is a very beautiful shrine located right along the beach, making it a truly scenic and peaceful place to visit. It can get a bit crowded at times, but the atmosphere and surroundings are worth it. There are also lots of nearby stores where you can grab snacks or souvenirs, which adds to the overall experience. Definitely a must-visit spot when you're in Itoshima.

places.generalDescription: Keya Beach is a popular sandy beach in Itoshima, offering shallow waters suitable for swimming and kayaking. It is one of the few officially designated swimming areas in the area, making it a safe spot for stand-up paddleboarding (SUP). During the summer, beach huts known as uminoe offer SUP board rentals geared towards leisure activities. The water is clean and clear, perfect for swimming even at a distance from the shore.

sources.snippet: Located on Itoshima, this is one of the most popular beaches in Fukuoka Prefecture, and for good reason. The beautiful blue waters of this sandy, tucked-away cove will make for a visit you won‚Äôt soon forget. There are plenty of beachfront facilities, and camping is available just steps away from the shore.
sources.shortName: Fukuoka Beach Guide

sources.snippet: It has been selected as one of the top 100 beaches of Japan by the Ministry of the Environment. The beach is situated in a bay outside of the metropolitan Fukuoka. The beach is accentuated by big boulders and green mountains.
sources.shortName: Take Your Pick At the Many Beaches of Fukuoka

sources.snippet: Highlights: Clear waters, swimmable, close to other popular attractions. Nearby attractions: Keya no Oto (Keya Cave), Shiraito Falls, Itoshima‚Äôs Totoro Forest. Events to look out for: Snorkeling tours, beach parties.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Fukuoka to Visit (+ Tips for Visiting)

places.name: Keya Beach

reviews.text: Clear and refreshing water. You can also shower for 500 Yen. 2 hours from Fukuoka. Nice, cozy and familiar place. The village is cute

Came here on 10.09.24 by taxi after visiting Sakurai Shrine torii. The beach is so quiet on the weekday. The sea is so calm. What we didn't know is that it's jellyfish season! They are transparent except four very long red brownish tentacles. There is no warning sign on the beach so I took the risk to swim. My right arm got stung pretty badly when getting out of the water. We found a restaurant called Bay Rock at the end of the beach offering food, drinks, toilet and shower. The staff was very nice to give me ice and itch cream for my arm. Took a bus to go back to Itsohima train station (please check the bus schedule as it's not frequent).

Chilly beach, but not for swimming; strong wind, few people there. Good place to relax.
Parking lot is available for free.

places.generalDescription: Keya no Ohto is a stunning coastal viewpoint in Itoshima, offering breathtaking views of the beach from its imposing ridgeline and a 64-meter cave below. The hike to the ridge involves some basic bouldering and rock climbing, making it suitable for athletic and experienced climbers. Accessible only by boat from April to November, the basalt cave within Genkai Quasi-National Park provides an otherworldly experience as visitors can venture inside depending on sea conditions.

sources.snippet: Keya no Ohto Cave (Ëä•Â±ã„ÅÆÂ§ßÈñÄ) is a 64 m high basalt cave located in Genkai Quasi-National Park. The cave can be only reached by boat during April to November. The boat can be booked at Shima town.
sources.shortName: Itoshima: Little Known Heavenly Beach in Fukuoka

places.name: Keya no Ohto

reviews.text: Due to the strong wind and wave, ferry ‚õ¥Ô∏è was cancelled.
Visited Saturday at 3p, and despite listed as open, boat ride was closed. Be aware that wind can close this at random. Still a pretty place to visit

The booth selling tickets to the cave was near to the bus stop.
On the boat, they have a recording on the area in Japanese, and the basalt cave was quite near.
Depending on the sea conditions, you may be able to go into the cave - I was able to touch the walls a little as the boat entered the cave's mouth. It feels like the underworld is straight ahead, with the darkness beyond.
I recommend you visit this place and stay for the food in the area.

places.generalDescription: Located west of Fukuoka City, the Itoshima Peninsula offers a delightful coastal experience. Visitors can savor fresh barbecued oysters at the kakigoya huts while enjoying other seafood options like squid, turban shell, and scallops. The peninsula is a popular summer destination with beautiful beaches and great surf, reminiscent of Bali or Thailand. Couples often capture romantic moments at sunset viewpoints such as Couples Rock.

sources.snippet: To the west of Fukuoka is the Itoshima Peninsula , the main summer destination for locals. On the peninsula's northern shore are some world class beaches, an active surfing scene, and Meoto Iwa, the sacred wedded rocks. To the south lie dramatic mountains, great hikes and the thundering cascades of the Shiraito Waterfall.
sources.shortName: Around Fukuoka City | Fukuoka | Kyushu | Destinations | Travel Japan

sources.snippet: It rewards those who discover it with beautiful beaches, exquisite food and peaceful sunsets. Here relaxation takes over people's everyday problems.
sources.shortName: Slow down in Itoshima | Kyushu Tourism Organization

places.name: Itoshima Peninsula

reviews.text: Place where  I enjoyed to the fullest,extremely beautiful japan xx

It is wonderful to drive out here. You will see scenic views of the coast that look like they are straight off a postcard. There are also many cool shops and sites of interest to check out. If you like coastal driving, taking cool photos, and the beach life, you should definitely take the time to check this place out for yourself.
Good place to unwind. there is cafe overlooking the beach.

places.generalDescription: Momochihama Beach is a man-made beach located in front of Fukuoka Tower. Despite its artificial nature, the 1 km stretch of sandy beach offers a picturesque setting with the Marizon building adding an exotic touch to the landscape. The beach provides a serene atmosphere, especially during cooler weather when it's less crowded. It's particularly beautiful to visit before sunset, offering stunning views of the blue sky and sea blending with the sandy shore.

sources.snippet: With a length of one kilometer, this artificial beach can be found at the base of the Fukuoka Tower. An artificial island known as Marizon can be found at the center of the beach. This island consists of shops, restaurants, a wedding hall, and a ferry port.
sources.shortName: Take Your Pick At the Many Beaches of Fukuoka

places.name: Momochihama Beach

reviews.text: Momochi Beach is a representative tourist attraction in Fukuoka. It is an artificial beach created through landfill work from 1982 to 1986. The beach spreads out in front of you along with Hakata Bay, creating a romantic landscape, making it a beach area where you can enjoy a resort-like atmosphere. Around Momochi Beach are Fukuoka Tower, Fukuoka PayPay Dome Stadium, and the large shopping mall Mark Is.

It's been a long time since I visited this beach! Despite many people, this branch was quite nicely kept clean! Many fun memories came back to me while I was walking around there.
You can look out nice view of the ocean while you can try some sea side foods at the cafe over there.
Nice location to be at and get relaxation!
Come enjoy sea side of Fukuoka!
It's nice that you get to see Fukuoka tower and dome!
Cheers ü•Ç
Very nice beach. Loads of sea shells on the beach. Come here for a nice stroll and catch the sea breeze. Loads of ice cream shops to choose from as well as restaurants.

places.address: 2 Chome-4 Momochihama, Sawara Ward, Fukuoka, 814-0001, Japan

sources.snippet: Nearby attractions: Shingu Central Park, Shingu Shrine, IKEA ;), Isozaki Shrine. Events to look out for: Local summer festivals, beach sports events. Things to do at Shingu Beach: Swimming during summer, picnicking, beach games.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Fukuoka to Visit (+ Tips for Visiting)

places.name: Shingu Beach

reviews.text: Fun place. Safe swimming.Can bbq. Cool environment.

Shingu Beach is a scenic coastal spot in Shingu Town, Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan. It is known for its clear waters, wide sandy shore, and relaxed atmosphere, making it a popular destination for locals and tourists alike.

Highlights of Shingu Beach

Water Activities: Ideal for swimming, paddleboarding, and windsurfing.

Family-Friendly: The calm waves make it a safe place for children to enjoy the water.

Beachside Restaurants & Caf√©s: Some cozy spots offer fresh seafood and drinks with ocean views.

Proximity to Fukuoka City: Easily accessible by car or public transport, making it a convenient getaway from the city.

I live nearby. Its a beautiful scenery with the pine tree forest, very thin sand and clear waters

Eventually thrash ends up washing up on the shore due to the tsushima current, but volunteers are doing their best to keep it clean

places.address: 1640-1 Shimonofu, Shingu, Kasuya District, Fukuoka 811-0112, Japan

sources.snippet: The hub of this area, though, is what‚Äôs known as ‚ÄúMarizon‚Äù, a waterfront facility styled after a Mediterranean resort. The paved thoroughfare is lined with a number of shops and restaurants and leads to a light and bright wedding venue over the water. The white cathedral, terracotta roof tiles, water features and bay views transport you out of Japan and onto another continent.
sources.shortName: Fukuoka City Beach Park & Momochi Seaside Park

places.name: Marizon

reviews.text: This is a great place to take a walk and soak in the pleasant vibes. The architecture is beautiful, resembling European styles, and the seaside atmosphere is lovely. It's a perfect spot to relax and take photos.

Marizon is a beautiful building located in Fukuoka that is famous for hosting weddings. While visitors are not allowed to enter the premises, it's still worth visiting for the architecture and beautiful views. It's also a great place to take photos.

Beautiful seaside facility but it's for wedding ceremony, visitor not concerning the wedding is not allowed inside.

However, passerby can enjoy beach front food & drink.

places.address: 2 Chome-902-1 Momochihama, Sawara Ward, Fukuoka, 814-0001, Japan

places.generalDescription: Miyajihama Beach is a stunning destination located at the end of a picturesque path extending from the shrine to the sea. It has become popular for swimming and surfing, with trendy cafes now lining its shores. Visitors can enjoy a scenic drive along the coast or take a leisurely stroll in this area. The beach features a beautiful torii at its entrance, creating a perfect harmony with the expansive shoreline.

sources.snippet: Nearby attractions: Miyajidake Shrine, Fukuma Beach, Fukutsu Seaside Park. Events to look out for: Local cultural events, traditional ceremonies. Things to do at Miyajihama Beach: Swimming during summer, visiting Miyajidake Shrine, beach walks, orange sunsets.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Fukuoka to Visit (+ Tips for Visiting)

places.name: Miyajihama Beach

reviews.text: It takes about 20 minutes on foot from Miyajidake Shrine.It is clean and quiet beach.

sunset is very beautiful
beach is very suitable for kids
there is paid bathroom but usually most people bring their own water or take at toilet nearby and change theit suit at the car
car parking is free
This is the best beach.

sources.snippet: Iki-no-matsubara Beach ‚Äì This beach offers a beautiful view of Nokonoshima Island. While there are no beachfront facilities available in the area, one may find a convenience store close to the station. The beach is also fairly clean and scenic.
sources.shortName: Take Your Pick At the Many Beaches of Fukuoka

reviews.text: The explanations are in English as well so I was able to understand more about the place. I enjoyed imagining how the invasion took place by looking at the glass frame explaining it.

The stone wall is about 3m high. It was built in 1276 along the beach to defend the invasion of the Mongolian navy from the Mongol Empire. There are illustrations to explain how the Japanese samurai were guarding on the wall.

It was 12 years ago (2009) that we got off the train to adventure around and stumbled upon this beach area. Not quite sure of it's history but it was a fun, quiet, well kept area not far off the busy main road. Take a lunch and beer, it's also got a great view of the bay.

places.generalDescription: Keya Beach Parking is a fantastic option for those looking to enjoy one of Japan's top 100 beaches. Nestled in a picturesque cove, Keya Beach boasts soft sandy shores and crystal-clear waters, making it an ideal spot for families and beach enthusiasts alike. The parking area is spacious and free, conveniently located near the beach and the Mt. Tateishi trailhead, perfect for those planning to explore the scenic trails nearby.

sources.snippet: Keya, one of Japan‚Äôs top 100 beaches and the annual host of the outdoor music festival ‚ÄúSunset Live,‚Äù is a delightful and well-protected cove. With its sandy beaches, clear waters, and gentle waves, it‚Äôs a dream for beach-goers. It is family-friendly, equipped with public restrooms, umi no ie (beach huts), and parking facilities.
sources.shortName: Fukuoka Beach Guide 2024

places.name: Keya Beach Parking

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) I visited on a weekday, and there were almost no cars parked there. I parked here and climbed Mt. Tateishi.

If you have tent-like items or a lot of luggage during the leisure season, we recommend parking at this parking lot early in the morning. Although the pavement is new and easy to use, it is not possible to drive directly from east to west. You need to get out on the road.

sources.snippet: This enchanting beach, featuring golden sands tucked away from the main road by verdant greenery, retains its clean and pristine charm. Snorkelers and divers will be drawn to the rocky Shirase Beach, the sole diving spot within Fukuoka City. It‚Äôs equipped with navigation ropes in the water, guiding visitors to the best underwater views.
sources.shortName: Fukuoka Beach Guide 2024

sources.snippet: Katsuma/Shirase ‚Äì Composed of golden sands, this beach remains clean because of its separation from the main road. It is the only diving spot in the city. Hence, snorkelers and divers frequently visit this beach compared to others.
sources.shortName: Take Your Pick At the Many Beaches of Fukuoka

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) The scenery is fun to cycle through. The scenery is different on the west and east sides of the island.

(Original)

places.generalDescription: Katsuma Beach is a hidden gem located on Shika Island, offering pristine and serene surroundings. Visitors can enjoy the beautiful sunset and explore nearby attractions such as Okitsu Island and Shiomi Park Observatory. The beach hosts local events, adding to the charm of the area. While facilities may be limited, the stunning sunset views make it a worthwhile destination for a relaxing day by the sea.

sources.snippet: For a change of pace, visit Katsuma Beach on the northern tip of the island. This beautiful stretch of shoreline is fringed by pine groves. Alternatively, check out the underwater environment on a diving tour.
sources.shortName: Coastal Escapes | Search

sources.snippet: Highlights: Located on Shika island, pristine, lesser-known beach. Nearby attractions: Okitsu Island, Shiomi Park Observatory. Events to look out for: local events.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Fukuoka to Visit (+ Tips for Visiting)

places.name: Katsuma Beach

reviews.text: Top beach go there
Clear water nice view, but not great for swimming because it's quite rocky
it is a beach like you would expect it in a remote location

(Translated by Google) We visited around 8am in July.
There were a few people fishing.
The sea was clear and beautiful. My child wanted to pick up some seashells, but there weren't any.

(Original)

(Translated by Google) As the name suggests, it is a long sandy beach that runs parallel to the ruins of the former military fortifications. The sea is pretty clean, but there's nothing else.

Even if you have permission, traveling to the coast and flying over people's heads is a violation of aviation law.
If you see one, let us know.

places.generalDescription: Itoshima is home to the stunning Futamigaura beach, known for its picturesque landscape featuring a torii gate and wedded rocks. The combination of the deep blue sea, clear skies, and pristine white torii gate creates a truly heavenly scene. Visitors can also witness breathtaking sunsets as the sun dips behind the wedded rocks. This beach offers an idyllic setting for nature lovers and those seeking tranquility by the sea.

sources.snippet: Itoshima has the beautiful beach called Futamigaura (‰∫åË¶ã„É∂Êµ¶) with the great landscape of a torii gate and wedded rocks behind. The contrast of the sea, blue sky and the pure white torii gate is just so heavenly. It‚Äôs also one of the places where you can watch the most beautiful sunset by the beach as the sun sets right behind the wedded rocks.
sources.shortName: Itoshima: Little Known Heavenly Beach in Fukuoka

places.name: Beach

places.generalDescription: Fukae Beach is conveniently located near Itoshima's train station, making it easily accessible for visitors. During the peak season, beach facilities offer food, drinks, and equipment rentals. The beach is spacious and provides a perfect setting to enjoy the sunset in Fukuoka. While there are no fees required to visit the beach, amenities may be limited during off-peak times. Fukae Beach is a favorite spot for both locals and tourists, offering opportunities for activities like surfing and swimming.

sources.snippet: Fukae is Itoshima‚Äôs most readily accessible beach, located just a short walk from the train station on the peninsula‚Äôs west edge. There are plenty of beach facilities selling food and drinks and renting equipment during the peak season, and it is fairly spacious. Access: Take the Kuko Subway Line, which will continue on as the JR Chikuhi Line from Meinohama Station in many cases (if not, simply change trains at Meinohama).
sources.shortName: Fukuoka Beach Guide

places.name: Fukae Beach

reviews.text:
A long beautiful beach with any necessities within walking distance, love hotel, too! Never saw any snakes...Early October surfing? Gotta go wetsuit. Going for a quick swim and you're good w/o one. Water was still warm enough. 2018-2019
Hung out one evening hoping for a nice sunset...was not disappointed. 2023
I visited the beach on a weekday.  It was quiet and beautiful.

A perfect place to enjoy sunset scene in Fukuoka. It takes around an hour to get the closest station, and then walk maybe 15 minutes to get to the beach. No fees required. However, I was visiting there in early March, the whole place looks a bit desolate. No stores or vending machines nearby the beach. It is still a nice spot to see the sunset along a typical Japanese coast.
